definitions.definition: An individual who has been granted personhood ; usually a human being .
examples: Each person is unique, both mentally and physically.

subdefinitions.definition: A character or part, as in a play; a specific kind or manifestation of individual character, whether in real life, or in literary or dramatic representation; an assumed character.
Any one of the three hypostases of the Holy Trinity : the Father , Son , or Holy Spirit .
Any sapient or socially intelligent being.
Someone who likes or has an affinity for (a specified thing).
examples: Jack's always been a dog person , but I prefer cats.
labels: in a compound noun or noun phrase
subdefinitions.label_groups: in a compound noun or noun phrase

subdefinitions.definition: A human of unspecified gender (in terms usually constructed with man or woman ).
labels: in a compound noun or noun phrase
subdefinitions.label_groups: in a compound noun or noun phrase

subdefinitions.definition: A worker in a specified function or specialty.
examples: I was able to speak to a technical support person and get the problem solved.
labels: in a compound noun or noun phrase
subdefinitions.label_groups: in a compound noun or noun phrase

definitions.definition: The physical body of a being seen as distinct from the mind , character , etc.
Any individual or formal organization with standing before the courts.
examples: At common law a corporation or a trust is legally a person .

definitions.definition: The human genitalia ; specifically, the penis .
A linguistic category used to distinguish between the speaker of an utterance and those to whom or about whom they are speaking . See grammatical person .
A shoot or bud of a plant ; a polyp or zooid of the compound Hydrozoa , Anthozoa , etc.; also, an individual, in the narrowest sense, among the higher animals.
A soulmate ; someone, especially a romantic partner, with whom one is exceptionally compatible and connected.

main_definition: An individual who has been granted personhood ; usually a human being . [from 13th c.]
secondary_definitions: The physical body of a being seen as distinct from the mind , character , etc. [from 14th c.]
( law ) Any individual or formal organization with standing before the courts. [from 14th c.]
( law , euphemistic ) The human genitalia ; specifically, the penis .
( grammar ) A linguistic category used to distinguish between the speaker of an utterance and those to whom or about whom they are speaking . See grammatical person . [from 14th c.]
( biology ) A shoot or bud of a plant ; a polyp or zooid of the compound Hydrozoa , Anthozoa , etc.; also, an individual, in the narrowest sense, among the higher animals. [from 19th c.]
A soulmate ; someone, especially a romantic partner, with whom one is exceptionally compatible and connected.
